intro: Veronica thymoides, commonly known as thyme-leaved speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–20 centimeters. The plant features small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the spring and summer months. Its leaves are narrow and resemble those of thyme, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
